sense.name: activity of selling
sense.examples: They tried to boost sales. Laws limit the sale of handguns. He has just made his first sale. They had to complete the sale before the banks closed.

sense.name: availability for purchase
sense.commentary: SALE[+state][+availability][+for_purchase] the state of being purchasable; offered or exhibited for selling
sense.examples: You'll find vitamin C for sale at most pharmacies. The new line of cars won't be for sale until next month.

sense.name: occasion or event to buy discounted merchandise
sense.commentary: SALE[+event][+occasion][+opportunity][+for_buying][+merchandise][+discounted] cut-rate sale, sales event - an occasion (usually brief) for buying at specially reduced prices
sense.examples: They held a sale to reduce their inventory. I got some great bargains at their annual sale. Women's shoes are on sale at Macy's tomorrow and Wednesday.

sense.name: written contract, official sales agreement
sense.commentary: SALE[+entity][+artifact][+document][+contract][+transfer][+of_property] an agreement (or contract) in which property is transferred from the seller (vendor) to the buyer (vendee) for a fixed price in money (paid or agreed to be paid by the buyer)
sense.examples: The salesman faxed the sale to his home office, to show his wife.
